page.title: 17The Game Keeper 1
page.content: Cairndow is well known for its Game Sports, Fishing and Hunting.The game keeper of Ardkinglas Estate has to patrol the river look after the traps and if someone goes shooting he would go with them.There are only two rivers in Cairndow that you need a permit for.They are the Kinglas and the Fyne. There are four beats (stretches of river for fishing) A B C and D. You are not allowed to fish on a Sunday. People often book the place for fishing at a beat and it would cost Â£265 pounds per week for two rods which is quite cheap compared to some other rivers . The people who come to Cairndow shoot about 30 stags per year and the keeper always goes with them. Deer are weighed in stones, last years average weight was 13 stone 11 pounds but they can be as big as 21 stone.
